title: (x) Southlake logo script - Voluta Script, Adobe Jenson {Yves}
content:
Hi. I’m looking to identify the font used for the word “Southlake”. Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Southlake.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612042737/http:/typophile.com/files/Southlake.jpg) | 39.03 KB |

 [‹ stencil type needs i.d](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612042737/http:/typophile.com/node/16508 "Go to previous forum topic") [Baltic Identity ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612042737/http:/typophile.com/node/16506 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Maverick

comments.content: [Viktor Solt-Bittner](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612042737/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Viktor%252BSolt-Bittner)’s [Voluta Script Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612042737/http:/store.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_1416.html) and [Robert Slimbach](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612042737/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Robert%252BSlimbach)’s [Adobe Jenson Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612042737/http:/store.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_1716.html), both released through [Adobe](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612042737/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Adobe).

Also now available at FontShop through Linotype:

[Voluta Script Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612042737/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.114182.0.0)  
 [Adobe Jenson Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612042737/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.114166.0.0)

... but Adobe shows their OpenType much better. We’re working on that.
